185976847.review:
This game holds a reputation of brutality, and for good reason. This is not a game you can play mindlessly. You must consider every tool on your roster, and have the foresight to know who to bring and the moves they should run. Failure to prepare can lead to a swift end, and simple ignorance combined with overconfidence can lead to the death of your party. 

However, if you know how to plan properly and are quick to learn, the game is far from unbeatable, or even unfair, for the most part. As you play, you will gain knowledge for each of the areas you can quest in. You will learn which of your heroes are good in certain environments, you will learn which enemies to target as threats, and you will learn how to synergize your party. It is a very rewarding experience, and as long as you can get over the fact that you WILL lose people along the way, this game can be an absolute blast to play.

咋说呢，黑暗克苏鲁风格本身倒不是很吸引我，吸引我的是角色养成和一些惊喜和意外。可以说怎么培养一个满级好用的英雄，从你刚招他入伍时就应该考虑了。为自己的英雄佩饰品，刷特质是这个游戏最投入的部分。
这个游戏难度也不小，通俗来讲这个游戏只有困难，极难和难的要死三种难度选择。新手入坑不看攻略，下地牢四个出地牢就疯5个，甚至无人生还。当然，难度带来的也是非凡的成就感。对于操作稀碎，无法上手魂系游戏的我来讲，这种战略性的困难（技能选择，释放时机，救人还是秒怪.....）也算是满足了我克服困难的爽快感。最后带着开始的两个英雄去打心脏的时候也感触颇多吧。
总的来讲，这个游戏需要点思考与战略选择，不看攻略的话建议还是不入手，毕竟看着自己亲手培养的角色死了真的很难受。

185930104.review:
I've completed many hard games over the last 30 years, some including Cup Head on the hardest difficulty, multiple dark Souls games, Elden Ring, all Bio-shock games on normal difficulty without dying once..

Difficult games, but fair to an extent.... But this game takes the absolute piss. Your "Heroes" get weaker the more they level up. A level 5 Hero will only tackle Dungeons >= Dungeon Level 5. Dungeon level 5 is impossible, even for a full team of level 4-5's. This is the same team that stomped through level 1-3 dungeons. Once you hit level 5 it goes from challenging to just outright impossible. 

Initial bosses can be beat with just a reasonable team and decent play, but the second round of bosses just outright jumps to impossible difficulty. Its a rock-paper-scissors style battle where you have to counter the boss specifically and has no room for anything else. Otherwise your team is just wiped out..

With the DLC it just makes the game even less fun (the DLC makes the game about 3x harder, not more fun)   
Not to even mention the tedious mechanics of constantly healing stress and removing negative perks through the sanitarium. 

You seem to hit a complete brick wall in this game after you start getting your teams to level 4 and beyond, enemies have mega health, your team members miss a lot, bosses are impossible, everyone gets blood plague.. it's just absolute garbage..

There's SO many mechanics I just HATE, which doesn't necessarily make the game challenging, it's just actually completely unfair. It's like trying to play chess against Stockfish on maximum level, the only way you can win would be to go online and get the answers given to you.. F*** this game I think it's the most hated game I've ever come across in the last 30 years and I've played a lot of games since back from the Amiga days.

185924724.review:
FGN:9/10 
   回合制策略游戏中少见的养成系，仅此一点就足够吸引人了。而其难度绝对算是硬核的，无论准备的多么充分，灌注时间和情感培养的角色依旧有永久死亡的风险，玩家能做的只有把一切风险降到最低，最后享受运营的成果，这也是暗黑地牢区别于大多数策略游戏的地方。
   另外游戏独特的地方还有游戏的亮度系统，将风险和收益直接挂钩使我非常喜欢，大多数游戏把难度调高不会将奖励提升，属于给高手证明实力了，而暗黑地牢除了有三个定死的难度外，玩家火把点的越多亮度越高就越安全，收益也越低，把火把舍弃的无光玩法虽然非常危险，但是收益显著提高了几倍，建议新手在高光难度玩一周目熟悉流程之后挑战二周目的无光，完全是两个不一样的体验。
   最后这个游戏很不适合自己闷头玩，需要大量获取玩家社区的小知识和攻略，另外创意工坊里的一些mod也可以显著提升游戏体验（战斗侦查加速，敌方技能图鉴，动漫皮肤等）

185821356.review:
高難易度でやりごたえ抜群のゲーム。
雑魚戦ですら緊張感があり、被弾を最小限に抑えるのがカギ。
ボス戦では、まず捨てパーティーで突っ込んで攻略法を練り直すのがオススメ。
キャラクターのレベルが上がると低難易度のクエストに連れて行けなくなり、ボス戦用のキャラクターを育てる必要があるのが少し面倒だけど、色んなキャラを使う楽しさもある。

戦闘システムはポジション取りが重要で、敵のポジションをずらす戦術が有効。
HPが0になっても即死じゃないから、戦略を練る楽しさがある。
ダークでカッコいい雰囲気、豊富な職業、ユニークなキャンプシステムなども魅力的。

ただ、理想のキャラクターを育てても最強にはなりにくく、「俺つえー！」って感じのカタルシスは少なめ。
高難易度で運要素も絡むので、失敗しても何かしらの蓄積が欲しかった。
装備や奇癖の管理が面倒で、準備が手間なのも気になるところ。

全体的にボリュームがあり、後半は少し作業感が出るけど、難易度や戦術を楽しむにはピッタリなゲーム。

185819937.review:
[h1]THE HORROR (OF EXCELLENCE)[/h1]
Darkest Dungeon is a game about hope. You will be thrown into a hostile, sickened world, where every corner and every facade tells a dark tale. You and your heroes are ill prepared for the journey ahead. Some will not make it through the night, and those left alive may yet envy the dead. But through it all, a moment of valor will shine brightly against a backdrop of despair. The hamlet can be repaired. The wounds can be mended. And victory can yet be achieved.

[h2]RNGenius[/h2]
Darkest Dungeon wants you to overcome tremendous odds with the help of flawed, human heroes, who often miss, get caught in traps, become anxious, steal treasure and disobey orders. One can’t discuss DD without talking about [b]randomness and how brilliantly it works in the game’s favor.[/b] That’s not to say DD is not skill expressive–quite the contrary–but your goal is to focus on the big picture. Sometimes a hero will miss twice in a row; sometimes the enemy will crit twice in a row. Sometimes a hero will lose a trinket while out in the town.

[i]And that’s okay![/i] It’s exactly what makes the game so much fun! [b]You are supposed to feel disempowered, in order for your triumphs to feel that much more meaningful[/b]. DD is a horror title first and a fantasy second. To quote the devs, you have to make the most out of a bad situation, ‘bad’ being the keyword here. Much of the game’s excellent design stems from preventing you from being in control, to facilitate an overwhelming sense of dread. The horror, then, is not only in the monster designs or the game’s difficulty. Only a truly hopeless scenario can set the stage for true acts of bravery.

[h1]GRIMPLAY[/h1]
In DD, you control a rotation of characters, each with different weapons and abilities, which you take on expeditions into four regions: the Ruins, the Warrens, the Woods and the Cove. In the dungeons themselves, you explore, fight, interact with doodads and collect treasure. Treasure is split into [b]gold[/b] and [b]heirlooms[/b], the latter of which are used for upgrading your home base. You have to complete enough side quests, before your heroes are strong enough to tackle the four endgame missions.

Leveling is not terribly exciting–every character can have all of their skills unlocked from level one, and each level simply gives their stats a small boost. The game’s complexity isn’t so much in the individual characters, as much as building the most well synergized party. Some heroes can mark enemies, which others can then exploit for massive damage. Some heroes cast debuffs, which tremendously help against certain tough enemies. Some are most effective in certain regions, and it’s up to you to take your chances and figure these things out. The game gives you the means to circumvent any challenge, but [b]only if you are open minded, and willing to experiment[/b].

What makes DD’s gameplay loop so satisfying is that [b]you are always in control of how hard the game is[/b]. Are the dungeons too easy? Just reduce the torchlight (and earn more loot). Is the game too tough? Get more supplies; torches, food, holy water. But remember that the safer you are, the less loot you accumulate–playing the game too carefully is not only boring but also a sign that you are not engaging with its systems enough. [b]The game is only a grind if you play poorly[/b]. Sure, at the start you will be taking very few risks, but the farther you go, the more you will push your heroes to the limit. Pull off those big fat crits. Try and hoard over 20k gold per expedition. The limited inventory space forces you have to decide between picking up loot, or holding onto to supplies.

The reward itself doesn’t matter nearly as much as the satisfaction you get from overcoming the game’s many remorseless systems. Trudging through one of the regions and barely making it out alive, [b]only to come back twenty hours later, with a properly set up party and utterly steamrolling the quest is one of the most satisfying feelings you will have in a turn-based RPG[/b]. This is the right way to play Darkest Dungeon–learning from your mistakes, picking yourself up, and getting back at the fiends with holy fury. Take risks when necessary, but always be prepared for the worst.


[h2]Stories[/h2]
The game’s robust lineup of systems makes it so that engaging stories practically write themselves. In my most recent game (on Stygian, the highest difficulty) I lost a hero during one of the end game quests, halfway through the map. Every player’s gut reaction at that moment would be to turn back, but I since I played on Stygian, I [i]had to[/i] push forward. There’s a time limit after all. I analyzed my chances and came to the conclusion that my initial game plan was sound, I had just got a little too cocky. Victory was possible; I only had to be much more careful. Focus struck me like a lightning bolt and I felt a tidal wave of determination to be the leader and confidently set my plan into motion. I felt like MacReady in [i]The Thing[/i], or Ripley in [i]Aliens[/i]. I was making strong, confident decisions, while risking losing the 40+ hours worth of a playthrough.

And I won! To somebody who hasn’t played the game, it’s impossible to describe just how daunting of a task it is to beat an endgame quest with 3 heroes left, on Stygian. In fact, I was so elated that I decided to join the DD Discord and tell others of my success, and I soon made a friend whom I talked with daily from that day onward. (In case you’re reading this, Loathe, what’s up, you cute sea monster you~).

Games like DD help you truly see what kind of person you are when things go awry. Do you panic? Blame RNG? Insult the devs? Or do you keep a cool head, recall your past triumphs and notice that adversity creates opportunities? That awful situations can bring out the best in us? At the end of the day, [b]the real game happens inside the player’s mind… which is another way of saying that DD is immersive as heck.[/b]. It’s telling that I have played the game for well over four hundred hours and still remember the names and party layout of the characters with whom I completed the game for the first time. Few games have ever managed to make me feel so disempowered, while at the same time daring me to do better than I think I can.

[h1]THE CONCLUSION… SUCH AS IT IS[/h1]
Darkest Dungeon clicks together like the innumerable teeth of a shambler. The permadeth brings the whole experience together. The Mignola-inspired art direction is top notch. The game’s soundtrack is magnificent and if you are playing with the music turned off, you’re not really playing DD in my book. To top it all off, the sparse, yet brilliant writing gives the game a much needed literary flair. Some of the heroes’ speech bubbles when they’re virtuous or afflicted vary from uplifting (“[i]Born of rage... destined to triumph!”[/i]), to unintentionally hilarious (“[i]Lord, this chastity belt chafes. Pass the lamp oil.”[/i]), to downright depressing (“[i]Come! My pitiable life deserves a pitiable end![/i]”). 

I don’t think you’ll be shocked to hear me conclude that I genuinely love this game. It’s a holistically brilliant title, where every design decision works in tandem to create more than the sum of its eldritch, wiggling parts. Nevertheless, as biased as I am, there is no denying that it is not a game for everybody. If you are adamant that randomness is an inherently bad piece of game design, then you are simply not going to have a fun time with DD, no matter how many mods you install, or how many guides you read. Some people just want to chill when gaming, and DD is not a turn-your-brain-off kind of game.

Darkest Dungeon is a tense, mind-bending experience designed to give you the highest of highs, and the absolute lowest of lows. You will either get on its level, or leave and play Stardew Valley instead.

185725241.review:
가장 어두움 난이도 클리어


하다보면 위저드리 생각이 많이 나는 게임. 정확히는 위저드리식의 던전탐색은 아닌데, 로스팅 시스템을 가져와서 극대화시켜둔 것 같은 게임이다. 위저드리는 1, 2 클리어하고 4는 중간에 보류중인데, 좀 특수한 시스템인 4를 제외하고 1, 2의 느낌이 굉장히 많이 난다.


아마 위저드리 특유의 크리티컬 시 즉사판정이 있는 몹들을 시스템으로 구현하기 위해 무진 애를 쓴 것 같다. 위저드리의 보팔버니, 사무라이 같은 몹들, 그리고 랜덤 인카운터가 파티를 전방위적으로 압박한다면, 다키스트 던전은 이 가짓수가 상당히 많아졌다. 이를테면 챔피언 난이도나 가장 어두운 던전에 진입하면서부터는 스트레스/독/출혈/폭딜 같은 요소들이 던전/층별로 극단적으로 나타나고 이를 잘 공략하는 것이 핵심이다. 아마 위저드리 특유의 던전탐색을 배제하다보니(플레이해보신 분들은 무슨 말인지 아실 것) 파티를 구성할 때 어떤 특성을 보이는 파티로 던전을 저격할 것인지를 주된 아이디어로 잡은 것 같다. 장신구라는 시스템도 여기에 한 몫 한다. 장신구로 힐 보정을 해준 성녀와 그렇지 않은 성녀는 아예 다른 캐릭터니까. 많은 사람들이 기벽 보정을 많이 신경쓰던데, 말도안되게 안좋은 기벽을 삭제하는 정도를 제외하면 클리어하는 데 큰 영향을 끼치지 않았다. 어차피 다 죽거나, 가장 어두운 던전 들어갔다 나오면 못 쓰게 돼서 ㅡㅡ 혈월 난이도에서는 신경쓸 수도 있겠다. 그리고 거의 확정적으로 좋은 기벽을 주는 비명자가 출몰하기에 그 때 고정해두면 됨


각 던전별로 세 단계의 난이도와 가장 어두운 던전, 그리고 핏빛 궁정이 게임 진행의 모든 단계마다 플레이어를 잘 설계된 난관에 부딪히게 만든다. 초반에 역마차에서 주는 영웅들이 랜덤이고, 파티를 구성하기에도 빠듯하기 때문에, 게임을 플레이하다 보면 각 영웅들의 특성과 파티를 구성했을 때의 시너지를 자연스럽게 알게 된다.


많이들 이야기하는 랜덤 요소는 단점보다는 장점으로 보인다. 오히려 이 게임은 RNG같은 랜덤 요소, 그리고 랜덤 인카운터가 배제되어있어, 던전이나 보스를 처음 공략할 때가 아니면 합리적으로 리스크를 관리할 수 있다. 랜덤을 어떻게 관리 가능한 요소로 길들이는가가 중요하다. 체급으로 누르거나 저격해서 패턴을 스킵하든, 지속딜이 가능한 조합을 짜서 버티든, 뭐든 간에.


너무 재밌게 했지만 다음과 같은 점은 단점으로 다가왔다.


1. 플레이타임이 길어짐


이게 특히 챔피언/가장 어두운 던전에 들어갔다가 몰살당하거나 한둘 죽고 퇴각하면, 핵심 영웅이 죽었을 경우 다시 레벨 5~6까지 키워야 한다. 위저드리의 머피처럼 그라인딩이 가능한 구간이 있는 것도 아니어서 그냥 쌩으로 0~1레벨 영웅들을 다시 만들어서 키워야 함. 거의 몇십 분이 여기에 들어가다보니 굉장히 짜증난다.


2. 황금조합이 어느 정도 정해져있음


가장 어두운 던전 전에 웬만한 던전을 다 공략할 수 있는 성녀-광대-노상강도(또는 방파자)-방파자 조합. 다른 조합이 필요할까 싶을 정도로 사기였다. 탱킹이 필요할 땐 노상강도를 중보병/성기사로 바꿔도 되고, 스트레스 힐이 필요 없거나 많이 필요 없으면 광대를 뺴고 4열에 중보병을 넣거나 조련사를 넣어도 된다. 검색해보니 이 조합을 성광실실이라고 부르던데 웬만한 던전은 장신구 보정을 해주면 이 조합으로 다 패버릴 수 있음.


물론 야영을 하면 방파자가 악몽을 꾸기도 하고, 어떤 던전은 다른 조합이 더 효율이 좋거나, 아예 특정 조합이 아니면 깨는 게 거의 불가능한 경우도 있다. 그러나 이런 특수한 경우를 제외하면 너무 범용성이 좋음. 심지어 일곱 번인가 악몽 꾸면 그 이후부턴 방파자에게 야영시 버프가 들어온다. 힐/스트레스 힐 모두 가능하고, 성녀를 제외하면 진영붕괴에도 강하며, 1~4열 어디든 타격할 수 있고, 딜이 필요한 경우 노상강도의 반격-영거리사격 콤보로 어느 정도 폭딜을 넣을 수도 있고, 심지어 방파자는 자체 무적기가 존재해 조건부 탱킹도 가능하다. 방어가 높은 보스가 나타나면 특히 방파자한테 군기 바로 잡힘. 다른 어떤 딜러를 넣으려 해도 뭐가 하나씩 빠지는 데 반해 이들은 큰 육각형을 그림. 단점이 있다면 폭딜이 쏟아지거나 체력돼지 보스한테 약하다는 건데 폭딜이 있는 던전에서만 다른 조합을 운용하면 되고, 체력돼지 보스는 힘들 뿐이지 스톨링하며 잡을 수 있는 경우가 대부분이다. 게임 컨셉을 생각해보면 모든 조합에 장점과 단점이 있어 필요할 때마다 운용할 수 있도록 해야 할 텐데, 이 조합은 게임의 컨셉에 역행한다. 개인적으로는 너프가 필요하지 않나 싶을 정도임. 이를테면 방파자의 데미지를 하향한다거나(애초에 방무뎀 자체가 사기라),,, 실제로 가장 어두운 던전 전에는 일정 시점 이후로 그냥 얘네만 거의 운용하면서 던전을 공략했다.


 3. 마지막 보스가 허무하다


가장 어두운 던전의 1~3층은 나름 긴장감있는 편인데 최종보스인 4층이 좀,,, 허접하다. 0레벨 4명을 척후병으로 보내 좀 패다보면 1페이즈 공략하는 법을 자연스럽게 알게 되는데, 문제는 1페이즈를 넘어가면 애가 호구로 변해버림(1페이즈도 뭐 별달리 위협적이진 않다). 허무하다 싶을 정도. 좀 더 이전까지의 난이도에 걸맞는 적으로 만들었어야 하지 않나 싶다. 사실 1~4층의 보스들이 다 어렵지 않다.차라리 1층/3층의 몹들이 훨씬 위협적이었던 것 같다. 3층은 던전 자체가 좀 위협적인 편.


4. 몇몇 중요한 게임상의 정보를 알 수 없음


이를테면 각 장신구의 능력치가 어떤 효과가 있는지 추측하기 힘든 경우가 있거나, 숨겨진 능력이나 확률이 있어도 알 수가 없다. 천상 대가리 박아가며 연구를 하거나 검색을 해야 함. 물론 안 해도 깰 수 있지만(안 했음) 왜 게임 시스템적으로 이게 제공이 안 되는지 불만이 느껴지는 건 어쩔 수 없다. 이거 말고도 많은데 클리어한지 좀 돼서 까먹음


5. 설정에서 속도 조절 좀 하게 해주세요


너무 천천히 걷고 너무 천천히 때리고 애니메이션들 사이에 딜레이도 많다. 창작마당에 유저들의 모드를 올린 것을 늦게 발견하긴 했지만, 내가 보기엔 이것도 늦다. 모션 스킵이 되게 만들든가 하여튼 뭔가 획기적으로 플탐을 줄이기 위한 조치를 해줘야됨. 플탐이 늘어질 수밖에 없는 게임에서 이런 자잘한 부분들이 합쳐져 쓸모없는 몇 시간이 흘러간다.



몇몇 단점들이 있음에도 불구하고 정말 재밌게 했던 게임. 나중에 생각나면 아마 혈월을 클리어하러 다시 올 것 같다.

Kendimi şansız itham etmek istemiyorum artık çünkü bir şey ardarda defalarca yaşanırsa bu şans olmaktan çıkar... Oyun zor değil aslında, yeşil görevler basit hatta herolar 2-3 level olunca aşırı basit, iş turuncu ve kırmızılara girince değişiyor.

Görevleri zorlaştıran etmen ise "şans" etkeni. Yani istisnasız her savaşta "şu adamı önden öldüreyim de en azından 3 kişi kalırlar daha az vururlar" dediğimde öldürmek istediğim adamı %90 ihtimalle kaçırmam ve "hayır arkadaşım bu adam ölmeden önce kesin bir vuracak sana bundan kaçarın yok" demesi oyunun. İstisnasız ama. Oyun zaten kimin sırası diye de göstermediğinden 15 speed adamımdan önce sırasını alan bu ölümsüz arkadaş bir koyuyor tüm takımın akıl sağlığının veya canının içine edip sonra görevini tamamlamanın verdiği huzurla ölüyor.

6 level 4 hero full set ve eşyalarla girdiğim kırmızı görevde daha yolda çıkan ilk savaşta takımın içinden geçilmesi üzerine artık bu oyuna yorum yazma vaktim geldi dedim. Adamlara %80'ler ıska geçiyor ama rakipler kritikleri ardı sıra koyabiliyor. Şans tabi şanstır.

Hayır yani çok basit şeylerin bile eklenmemesini es geçtim hadi. Mesela göreve gideceksiniz ve bazı adamlarınız için gideceğiniz bölge kötü. Mesela ruin bölgesinde daha fazla stres alıyor veya başka adamınız ise aksine orada daha iyi gözlem yapıyor. Bunları ya ezberleyeceksiniz ya da tek tek tıklayıp bakacaksınız. Yahu bölgeye tıkladığımda bu adamların yanına bir imge falan koy da kimin bonusu var kimde yok bilsek? Bu bölgedeki yaratıklar genel olarak nedir söylesen de ona göre kanama mı alayım zehir mi alayım karar versem? 

Ama yok oyun yapımcıları bizim bir hayatımız olmadığını sanıyor ki böyle çok basit eklentileri eklemek yerine sabah akşam onların oyununu oynayacakmışız gibi her zıkkımı ezberlememizi bekliyorlar. Kolaylaştıma hak getire ama müstehak tabi, bu oyunun bu eksiklerini yazmak yerine yağlayıp ballayıp çok daha satılmasını sağlayan oyuncular suçlu... Bunlar nasıl olsa aptal diyerek 40 kere aynı oyunu satan firmalar da hala devam ediyor bu yüzden de.

Oyun zor değil abartıldığı kadar, oyunu zor olsun diye eksik bırakıp bazı noktalarına müdehale edilmiş o kadar.

185655948.review:
Похоже, что игру создали по лекалам мобильной гачи, только без доната. Особой глубины по наполнению игры тут нет, увы. Глядя на отзывы, я ожидал, что тут будет более масштабная реализация мира, механик и сюжета. А что тут есть? Есть десяток статических экранов типа: экран города, где надо прокачивать здания; экран здания, где надо прокачивать или лечить персонажей; экран персонажа, где надо включать нужные навыки и снаряжать амулеты, и ещё проверять статы. 

Сюжет подаётся, как в новеллах — текстом с иллюстрациями на вступлениях к выбранной миссии. Сюжет не зацепил. Исследование мира отсутствует. Кроме самих боёв в игре есть лишь прокачка в городе и брождение по подземельям, и то довольно условное: слайд коридора, слайд комнаты и случайно разбросанные по ним сундуки, ловушки и враги. А, ну есть ещё механика привала, со своими отдельными навыками на бафы и лечение. В общем, реализация скромная, выглядит дёшево и сердито. Даже удивительно, что игру так расхвалили. Но надо отдать должное, пошаговые тактические сражения тут действительно увлекательные. Несколько слов о них.

Герои различаются по специализации, типа бойцы ближнего и дальнего боя, или саппорты и лекари. Кроме включения в отряд персов разных специализаций, важно правильно расставить их в отряде, т.к. разные навыки работают лишь на той или иной позиции. В ходе боя позиции могут меняться, где-то управляемо, где-то из-за атак противника. Соответственно, будут открываться или закрываться доступные навыки. Приходится принимать решения: тратить ход на доступные действия или на перемещение в отряде. Ну и прочая более привычная история, типа: прокачка персонажей, оружия и брони; а также наличие статусных состояний, типа: яд, кровотечение, невидимость, усиление и ослабление статов. Плюс местная особенность: стресс или воодушевление, которые передаются другим героям отряда и, соотвественно, помогают или мешают в бою. 

Я, кстати, так и не понял, как распределяется очерёдность хода между персонажами в ходе каждого раунда. Вроде у них есть параметр скорости, но при этом раунд может закончиться ходом противника, а следующий начаться опять с него же, видимо порядок случайный. Вообще, визуализация очереди ходов сильно помогла бы в выстраивании тактики боя. А так приходится лишний раз рисковать, выбирая между лечением и атакой, если есть раненные.
В заключении скажу, что игра способна увлечь, так что я её всё же порекомендую любителям тактики, но большой глубины от игры не ждите.

Оценка 6,5 выживших героев из 10

对身体与心灵的沉重打击！

遍体鳞伤，仅存一息……

人的心智——如知更鸟的蛋般柔弱。

疯狂——是智慧最崇高的形态， 或者只是有人曾这么说过。

深渊被人为地制造了出来！

185559552.review:
★★★★★
[b] ▲ Lo bueno: [/b] Tiene un estilo artístico que amo, me encanta cómo se ven los personajes y el entorno. El narrador no solo acompaña sino que realsa el juego de una manera sublime.  Agrega emoción en los momentos oportunos y no llega a ser pretensioso o tedioso en ningún momento. 
Sus niveles de dificultad están bien adaptados y si tuviese que considerar algo "negativo"...

[b] ▼ Lo malo: [/b] Diría que algunas composiciones son mucho mejores que otras, lo que puede limitar un poco la variedad. Claro que tranquilamente podés armar tu propia composición y usar Cruzados como healers y Vestales como dps; no es eficiente, pero se puede lograr con los artefactos adecuados.

▷ Darkest Dungeon es una joyita. Su arte, su atmósfera y el narrador hacen que sea una experiencia única. Aunque hay algunas limitaciones en las estrategias, sigue siendo un juego que recomendaría sin pensarlo dos veces.

Открыл битву с боссом, увидел хороший лут, побоялся, что пропадет задание, так как они регенерятся каждую игровую "неделю". А ОТКУДА МНЕ БЫЛО ЗНАТЬ, что битва с боссом останется на месте, даже если выполнять другие задания? Потерял двух бойцов из-за чудища, которое сначала скинуло на меня потолок, а потом не позволило выйти из боя сразу проведя вторую атаку. Одним из тех бойцов была медичка почти третьего уровня. Смирился. Нашел себе в таверне еще одну медичку. "Весталку" 

На 16 неделе захожу отрядом полностью 3 уровня в оранжевый данж, где в одном из коридоров вторую мою и последнюю медичку фокусят подряд 6 раз 3 противника. на 5 раз ее доводят к присмерти и станят, на 6 убивают. Она стояла сзади без каких-либо дебафов. Успел расправиться с двумя мобами, понадеялся, что ее не будут В ШЕСТОЙ РАЗ ПОДРЯД ПОДРЯЯЯД бить, а нет. Я был не прав. Один лишь мат на ум лезет. А на 17, черт ... дери "неделе" я так и не увидел еще ни одну другую "Весталку". НИ ОДНУ. ДВЕ "ВЕСТАЛКИ" за 17 недель. КАААК? Опускаются руки, горят нервы. 

Я искренне не рекомендую эту игру. В ней слишком много рандома, который зачастую случайным образом оказывается против игрока, "СЛУЧАЙНЫМ" образом фокуся единственного медика не то, что в пачке, а во всем сохранении, городе..

185467436.review:
I expected something different from this game, a kind of exploration and a huge loot spiral and equipping as much as you can. In some cases that's true, it's just much harder and the dungeons are merciless.

You get through the dungeons with a lot of effort, including buying all the torches and turning every optimization screw, otherwise the enemies will wipe the floor with you.

After a while you get used to the fact that your heroes have disappeared, have lots of debuffs and aren't able to fight, or you have to recruit new heroes because someone has died again.

Definitely a great game for anyone looking for a challenge in a game. Target group of players: masochistic people.

185334664.review:
差评！ 这里我不评价PVE模式，1的PVE模式很好， 比2 好玩。
主要是说下屠夫竞技场，也就是PVP，差评，现在版本值得一个差评，  很能让你血压升高
角斗场绝对不是公平的，首先说捆绑包角色比原版角色都强一个强度，你要是没买捆绑包就建议别玩PVP了，特别难获胜。血僧基本杀不死一个技能回满， 蛇盾+血僧有时候可以2V4原版人物  ，火枪也比弩手伤害治疗各方面都高一个强度。
如果你说那大不了买捆绑包就平等了嘛，
也不见得。就算是同样的英雄，同样的装备，玩家等级不同，各自表现可以说是天差地别，而这个游戏玩家的等级与英雄的面板和属性明明是毫无关联的；有时候你120%位移技能概率，对方25%位移抗性 你就是拉不动他，但是他无装备情况同英雄拉你85%位移抗性的角色随便乱拉，  你的命运重构带治疗装备情况下暴击+4HP，多的时候12，13HP ，对方不带任何治疗装备命运重构暴击就是加40或者30多HP， 你带输出的麻风王 砍对面一般就是十几的伤害，对面带防御装的麻风王砍你暴击一下25-30起步，毫无公平可言，一个英雄满血就30左右，玩个P，一刀濒死，你的行动机会都用来抢救了，别人的行动机会就用来揍你，要是敢不抢救你的英雄马上就敢原地去世，你回血半天有时候还没别人一个技能打的多。  
别人35%防御你觉得根本打不动，不加标记，后排打一下对面有时候都是个位数伤害，你的35%防御的肉对面照样三四刀带走，标记了的话基本上就是一下两下的事了 。
一般对面如果等级比你高， 基本这局匹配就输了， 就算对面退出，人机带打你都打不过
对面的人HP被你打归零了，你有50%致命的技能，打他一直死亡抗性，你都不知道他隐藏HP有多少。你的人要是HP归零，流血都能流死。
你终于运筹帷幄，把对面血打空了，你的赏金猎人一百多精准一百多致死，要收割他了，他有个10左右的闪避都能闪开，不是？我30闪避的角色这种情况怎么从来不会闪避？
你的治疗加血回复一层刮痧血皮，对面直接空血加到大半血，同英雄同装备你怎么评  人太帅了所以这方面就是要有所损失是吧
你的人精神崩溃了，直接念完台词就变成一坨烂肉，毫无操作余地
对面被你打精神崩溃了，循环从200SAN值回升到175SAN值，又能砍你了，崩溃动画倒是不断的放额，但你根本就不能让他崩溃而死。
刚开始匹配一路连胜，对面都打不过你，和强的对手打到剩下一两个空血残胜，或者阵容被克制、犯了错被虐杀，操作前后没有想太多而输，都很有意思，输了也觉得对面很强，甚至想夸对面。 但从某天开始，经过坚持不懈的匹配 ， 终于， 你知道了，气运之子你注定打不过。 这玩毛。 本来这种PVP方式是很有趣的 ，失去了最基本的数值上和玩法上的公平 玩毛。我很纠结给好评还是差评   PVE值得好评，PVP本来也很有趣，但是你这样搞是吧，只有差评了。

       以上是我上次的评论，虽然上次写了这么的多，嘴上说着要差评，但我依然给的是好评，但是这次更新评论确实是忍不了了。 终于凑出一套可以虐杀血僧的阵容了，也赢了几场，我不知道是不是制作者担心连胜会无聊？多胜利两场，机制又会开始不平衡了，首先是匹配机制，我几乎经常匹配到段位图标高得我都不认识的玩家，这就算了，跟他作战的时候不太正常，我不知道是不是故意让你难以获胜，有时候行为很不合理。正常的思路下，英雄穿两个防御装，防御力提高，应该能够抵挡更多的伤害，但是对面没有输出装备的英雄在标记下还是能够秒杀你的防御英雄，轮到你的时候，你打对方的防御英雄就是刮痧，这样对比起来是很不平衡的。而且对面的技能几乎不会空，而你的就会空，甚至无关面板上的百分比数值。
       按照设置，在4个英雄都存活的情况下，每个英雄刚进行完行动，就得轮到另一名英雄活动，但是今天刚遇到一把，对面的弩手连续行动两次，一次标记射击把我30防御 44血的蛮子秒成空血， 第二次直接致死 。 还有，那一把对面的眩晕几率几乎是100% ，从我刚开始打到战败，我的小丑被晕得1回合都没行动过，而我的击退对面25%位移抵挡的居然能抵挡，我的进攻 对面5闪避的竟然能闪开，我40闪避的英雄一下也不会闪避，技能全中。对面没有一个死亡抗性的装备，0 HP时，我攻击他5次左右他都不会死 ，我的英雄HP掉到0时，对面无致死率英雄的范围伤害技能也能把我的英雄致死， 对面3人时回合与我都是一人一回合，我3人对面4人时，对面每次比我多一回合，过于明显的不平衡， 这样的话真的，我开始认为这个游戏没有玩下去的必要了，明明是一款优秀回合制策略作战游戏

185322264.review:
[b]
Darkest Dungeon is about making the most of a bad situation. Quests will fail or must be abandoned because at a certain point, the game will begin to persecute the party until some hero finally died, then reset its RNG back to normal. Heroes will die because of what is said before, Red Hook somehow believes you shall not finish a run without losing anyone. And when they die, they stay dead, which is trashtalking here. Progress autosaves constantly, so actions are permanent even if you disagree with such racist design.

The game expects a lot out of you. How far will you push your adventures against the deliberate tease from Red Hook? How much are you willing to risk with your patience and mental health to restore the Hamlet? What will you sacrifice to try saving your favorite hero but be ready to face guaranteed death since the game will make it so with viciously adjusted bad luck, only too obvious to not expose just like SBMM from online games?

Thankfully, there are always fresh souls buying this unworthy game, seeking both adventure and fame in the shadow of the...[spoiler]veil intention and stupidity of Red Hook[/spoiler] 
[/b]

Years earlier, I personally suffered psychosis and led a hard life. Now I regret I didn't become a developer to try making a game.

185319469.review:
The game has a decent structure to it, I think it's really neat for a lot of things, but on the normal difficulty I always feel like I'm falling behind no matter what I do and it's very depressing or punishing without much incentive. Everything costs me 20-30% more than I can afford, in terms of pretty much all ratios.

I think it's creative and very fun for a lot of people, but for wanting to make consistent progress and learn from mistakes and be able to increase success rates, it absolutely never came around to that. Failures were cascade, even with a good spread of abilities, every team I had felt brittle, and by the time I had decently strong characters to be able to survive more reliably, I find out that there's a cap for allowed levels for certain difficulty quests.

185183674.review:
[b]Darkest Dungeon (DD) – Ein Meisterwerk der Dunkelheit & des Überlebens[/b]

Darkest Dungeon ist nicht einfach ein Spiel, es ist ein emotionales, nervenaufreibendes Erlebnis, das den Spieler in eine düstere Welt eintauchen lässt, die sowohl physisch als auch psychisch eine Herausforderung darstellt. Es ist ein rundenbasiertes Gothic-Rollenspiel mit Roguelike-Elementen, das die psychischen Belastungen und den mentalen Stress, den Helden in einer finsteren Welt erleben, thematisiert. Während viele Spiele sich auf das Kämpfen & Überleben konzentrieren, geht (DD) einen Schritt weiter und erkundet die inneren Kämpfe seiner Charaktere und fordert den Spieler über ihre Emotionalen Grenzen herraus, was (DD) zu einer einzigartigen und unvergesslichen Spielerfahrung macht.

Die Atmosphäre & Story – Dunkelheit bis in die Seele

Die Geschichte von (DD) entfaltet sich in einer von Verzweiflung geprägten Welt, in der das Böse längst den Sieg davongetragen hat. Deine Aufgabe ist es, eine Gruppe von Helden anzuführen, die sich den tiefsten Abgründen der Menschheit stellen müssen. Das Spiel beginnt mit einem großen Geheimnis: Ein verfluchtes Anwesen, das tief in den Abgründen des Landes verborgen liegt, weckt das uralte, böse Erbe einer längst vergessenen Vergangenheit. Deine Gruppe von Helden muss sich dieser Dunkelheit stellen, sei es durch das Erforschen verlassener Ruinen, das Bekämpfen von monströsen Kreaturen oder das Entschlüsseln von Geheimnissen, die zu düsteren Wahrheiten führen.

Die Handgezeichnete Grafik im Federkielstil und die melancholische Musik verstärken das Gefühl, in einer Welt zu leben, die von Hoffnungslosigkeit durchzogen ist. Der ständige Druck der dunklen Umgebung, die von immerwährenden Bedrohungen geprägte Welt und die düstere Szenerie verstärken das Gefühl der Beklemmung. Die Charaktere sind nicht nur in der Welt gefangen, sondern auch in ihren eigenen inneren Dämonen, die durch den Stress ausgelöst werden. Die Story selbst ist ein düsterer Albtraum, der die Welt aus der Sicht der Helden und ihrer gelebten Qualen darstellt.

Das Qualensystem – Deine Helden werden gebrochen

Ein zentrales & herausragendes Element von (DD) ist das innovative Qualensystem, das sich von anderen Spielen unterscheidet, indem es die psychischen Belastungen der Charaktere als Teil des Spiels betrachtet. Deine Helden sind nicht nur auf der Körperlichen Ebene angreifbar – sie werden auch von den Schrecken des Abenteuers & der ewigen Dunkelheit gezeichnet. Der Stresslevel eines Charakters kann bei jeder schlechten Erfahrung steigen, wenn er von Albträumen geplagt wird, eine Niederlage erleidet oder eine grässliche Kreatur tötet. Ein hoher Stresspegel hat nicht nur direkte Auswirkungen auf die Fähigkeiten und die Kampftauglichkeit eines Helden, sondern kann auch dazu führen, dass er psychische Störungen entwickelt, wie etwa Paranoia, Wahnsinn oder Angst. Diese Zustände beeinflussen seine Handlungsmöglichkeiten & können auch zu extremen Verhaltensweisen führen, wie etwa plötzlicher Panik oder dem Verlust jeglicher Kontrolle über seine Handlungen.

Das Qualensystem fügt dem Spiel eine besondere Dimension hinzu, da du nicht nur gegen die Gegner kämpfst, sondern auch gegen die wachsende Verzweiflung deiner eigenen Gruppe. Es zwingt dich dazu, dich mit den enormen Belastungen der Helden deiner Gruppe auseinanderzusetzen & ständig zwischen dem Überleben der Charaktere & ihrer geistigen Gesundheit abzuwägen. Deine Entscheidungen – welche Helden du auswählst, wie du mit ihrem Stress umgehst & wie du sie von ihren geistig Wunden heilst – werden für den Erfolg oder Misserfolg deiner Expeditionen entscheidend sein.

Die Kämpfe & Taktik – Überleben auf Messers Schneide

Das Kampfsystem in (DD) ist ebenso brutal wie die Welt, in der es spielt. Es ist ein rundenbasiertes System, bei dem du deine Gruppe strategisch aufstellen musst, um gegen die zahllosen monströsen Gegner zu bestehen, die in den Dungeons lauern. Dabei wird jeder Schritt des Spiels zur Herausforderung. Ein Held, der unter hohem Stress leidet, ist möglicherweise weniger in der Lage, präzise zu kämpfen oder seine Fähigkeiten effektiv einzusetzen. Aber nicht nur der Stress deiner Charaktere kann den Kampf beeinflussen – die Gegner, denen du begegnest, sind alles andere als einfach und werden sich nicht ohne weiteres besiegen lassen. Von schrecklichen Bestien über untote Krieger bis hin zu abstoßenden und bösartigen Kreaturen – jede Begegnung fordert dich heraus und zwingt dich, tief über deine nächsten Züge nachzudenken.

Ein weiterer wichtiger Aspekt ist die taktische Tiefe der Kämpfe. Du kannst deine Gruppe aus verschiedenen Klassen von Helden zusammenstellen, die jeweils ihre eigenen Fähigkeiten & Schwächen haben. Vom Heiler über den Krieger bis hin zum Fernkämpfer – jedes Mitglied bringt seine einzigartigen Stärken & Fähigkeiten ins Spiel. Es geht darum, wie du diese verschiedenen Kräfte im Kampf optimal kombinierst, um die Feinde zu besiegen, ohne dass deine Gruppe zu viel Schaden nimmt. Die Kämpfe selbst sind extrem taktisch, da du in jeder Runde genau überlegen musst, wie du deine Ressourcen einsetzt & deine Helden platzierst, um den größtmöglichen Nutzen zu erzielen.

Fazit – Eine unerbittliche, aber lohnende Herausforderung

(DD) ist ein Spiel, das sowohl für seine Härte als auch für seine tiefgründige psychologische Auseinandersetzung bekannt ist. Es ist ein Spiel, das dich nie wirklich entlässt, das dich mit seinen düsteren Themen, den schwierigen Entscheidungen & den geistigen Belastungen, die du deinen Helden zumutest, immer wieder herausfordert. Es ist nicht einfach – im Gegenteil, es ist brutal, gnadenlos & oft zutiefst entmutigend. Doch wer sich dieser Herausforderung stellt, wird mit einer der intensiven & lohnenden Erfahrung belohnt, die die Welt der Videospiele zu bieten hat. (DD) fordert den Spieler heraus, über seine eigenen Ängste & das Konzept des Überlebens hinauszudenken & sich den dunklen, unbarmherzigen Kräften zu stellen, die die Welt beherrschen. Es ist ein Spiel für diejenigen, die den Mut haben, sich dem Grauen zu stellen. Für Überlebende ist der Erfolg schwer fassbar, doch die Reise dort hin ein wahres Meisterwerk.

185090114.review:
I bought this game on 2018. It has taken me almost 7 years to finish it. The main game, at least. When I first played it, it had been on Radiant. I was Not Very Good at games, and the unforgiving nature of Darkest Dungeon and my lackluster gaming skills, even on Radiant, meant that opinion turned from 'Not Very Good' to 'Oh Girl, You Are So Much Worse At This Than I Realized.' It had ended with me throwing my hands up in surrender after suffering a team wipe twice, almost in a row, first from the Shambler, and then later to Vvulf. Despite that, I resolved to one day come back and finish this damn game.

And 7 years later, I come crawling back with gritted teeth and bloodied fingers, triumphantly better than ever before. My days of being 'Not Very Good' was over. I was now 'Eh, Acceptable.' And that was enough to fulfill a goal that was more than half a decade old. On Default Difficulty, even! 

(I will not try it in Higher Difficulties. I know my limits. Confidence is an insidious killer, and all that.)

Anyway, all that was to say, very dramatically, that I've finally finished it. Wonderful game. I absolutely love the sound effects and, of course, the narrator. It all really sets the Lovecraftian vibe the game was going for. While I was playfully complaining about the difficulty earlier, I didn't actually hate it. Struggling to be better, to improve, to overcome said difficulties made the victories all the more sweet. From what I understand, the game was purposely designed like that. It's supposed to be hard. It's supposed to be frustrating. And the challenge of it really elevated my experience playing the game.

I might one day return. I still haven't defeated one of the mini bosses that made me quit the game in the first place (I Am Coming For You, Shambler). Some achievements here and there that I want to get. And, of course, the DLCs that I've been hearing good things about. 

Truly, one of the best games I've ever played. <3

Build weapons armor, learn to upgrade skills, lock good quality, cure stubborn eccentricities, Lane gradually real top talent. Lane can stun threatening enemies in the back row - her speed is destined to lead. Lane can torment the bloody horror boss - her plague is unforgiving. However, in a mid-level instance that was supposed to be quiet, she died - from a series of concentrated crit attacks by ordinary monsters. In that copy, I managed to bring the rest of the team back to town, along with boxes of money and ancestral property. But Lane died forever and never came back. It pains me that all the time and resources devoted to training Lane are meaningless; there is no plague doctor named Lane on the list of adventurers, It makes me confused. The next day, however, I recruited a new plague doctor to take Lane's place, and then I took Lane's life for money and supplies, To upgrade pubs and churches. This town needs me to save, my father's honor needs me to restore, I can not lose a mercenary and stop. Soon, good adventurers came to town and I hired them. I learned from Lane's experience and was more cautious and steady - I was determined not to lose my well-trained players. But fate mocked every confident fool, and again and again I left the adventurer's broken arm to the monster, Just cold heart to take back the precious ornaments from the body of the hero. The cemetery expanded again and again, the town became more and more prosperous, and more and more adventurers came in search of treasure and opportunity. I gradually stopped feeling grateful and guilty - as long as I brought back my possessions, The life of an adventurer is worth dying for, and I don't waste time pretending to mourn in a cemetery where there are more tombstones than there are theoretical heads in a town. The town has become a bloody mouth, devouring every comer full of ideals and curiosity. The dawn's bloody sky faded, the voices of the guild and the tavern rose, and four chosen new adventurers came to me. Looking forward to me, hoping that I can bring them honor and money, I smiled and hung the orange ornaments around their necks - the morning light, The blood of the old owners on the jewelry has turned black. Looking at these simple and excited adventurers, I suddenly felt a little frightened and confused: I, and the underground things, who is the devil?

The game is a great unintentional explanation as to why the early editions of D&D combat could be annoying slogs. Gold, gems, magic items, and upgrades lose their luster quickly. You're SUPPOSED to treat your adventurers like disposable pawns, like some players treated their characters in the early TTRPG days. It's a focal point of the game, slowly losing your attachment to adventurers and becoming comfortable with them dying.

The analogy ends once you hit the final dungeon, though.

184975854.review: У меня все от чумы сдохли

184971011.review:
I want to preface this review by saying that Darkest Dungeon is honestly an incredibly well designed game. It knows exactly what it wants to be, how to accomplish that, and is dripping in visual atmosphere. The amount of detail and effort on display is incredible, and there's truly nothing like it.

The problem is, what it is trying to accomplish to be a game that truly feels like you're fighting an unstoppable, unknowable force with no happy ending. And it succeeds at that in spades. It's just that actually PLAYING such a scenario sucks. It's grindy, it's random, and even if you suffer through it, there's no grand reward at the end. Just death. 

It's a perfect encapsulation of the cycle of the ancestor, forever chasing after power that he should not have indulged in at the cost of everyone around him. You will become him if you play this game. You have to become him in order to win. You have to see people as tools, to no longer care WHY you're doing this, and just do it because you have to. Dump endless amounts of money until one day, you finally destroy the world around you. Out of every game I've ever played, it has perhaps the strongest ludonarrative of all time.

And that's just the issue. That situation sucks, and Darkest Dungeon will make you feel that. The same design decisions which create this experience also contribute towards making the game a slog to play at every possible opportunity. And there's no real reason to actually experience the game, as it doesn't provide anything worth the amount of time it asks of you. Because that's really the only "good" ending that could exist in a story like this: if the story never happens at all.

The only winning move is not to play, indeed.

There isn’t much I can say that other reviews haven’t covered, I’m adding this review because of the joy and time I’ve spent on this game. I would just say this. Honestly give the game a fair chance on the regular difficulty and just as the loading screen says, you will have set backs. 
The victories can be a huge high and the defeats can be brutal, it rewards careful planning and learning, then at times it will just throw all your careful plans against the wall with some bad luck.
It’s not perfect, the negative reviews mostly cover how the RNG can feel weighted against you and grinding characters back up takes time and effort.
The art is really gritty, the music is intense and having Wayne June (the voice of Lovecraft) punctuate your failures and victories can really extra weight to the game.
Even the story of game development and release (Darkest Dungeon Documentary - It Would Suck To Be A Hero) shows how much heart went into this game  
Get it on sale or pay full price, it’s worth it either way.

184805200.review:
Darkest Dungeon is a turn-based combat game with some exploration, expedition planning, base upgrading, and roster management thrown in for good measure.

One part of the game is spent at the Hamlet, where you manage your roster of heroes (accepting new heroes and paying for training, equipment, and healing) and upgrade the town.

The rest of your time is spent delving into dangerous dungeons. You need to plan out each expedition by choosing the right heroes and giving them the right skills and equipment. You then control the team as they move left-to-right along corridors and into rooms. They encounter points of interest (such as treasure chests, mysterious shrines, or battles) along the way. The delve goal is usually to explore 90% of rooms or defeat all room combat encounters.

The point of the game is basically to learn how its various systems work, level up the Hamlet and your heroes, and then kick the ass of the final dungeon (the Darkest Dungeon, obviously).

I played 87 hours to complete the game on the easiest (Radiant) difficulty. I had fun most of the time, but had no interest in starting over to play harder or longer difficulty levels.

THE GOOD:

- Perfect hand-drawn graphics, music, sound effects, and narration really suck you into the game's disturbing world. I adore the main game menu's song, it's equal parts majestic and disturbing.
- Overall, the game is quite gripping, with meaningful strategic and tactical choices to make throughout. There is lots to learn, discover, and adapt to. It's a genuine challenge.
- Darkest Dungeon is an emotional roller-coaster, with dizzying highs when you succeed against all odds and terrifying lows when you fail miserably despite your best efforts.
- One of the unique elements of this game is the importance of the party's marching order. Your 4 characters are arranged in a specific order, as are the enemy team. Which enemies your characters can attack is heavily dependent on where your character is located as well as where the enemy is located. This adds some interesting strategy that can take a while to master.
- When your heroes become over-stressed they can either handle it poorly (becoming afflicted) or well (becoming virtuous). It's an interesting mechanic because while your heroes will almost always become afflicted, those rare moments when they become virtuous (it only happened to me 3 times in 87 hours) can be crazy cool.

THE BAD:

- There are different mission types, but I spent 95% of my time in the same mission type ("explore 90% of rooms"). This did get old eventually. I feel like the developer could have done more to improve the variety of the delves.
- I spent a surprising amount of time planning out expeditions. The preparatory steps got to feel quite repetitive once I figured out the optimal choices. The game could have made this a bit less onerous, perhaps by remembering my settings from last time.
- The handling of hunger during delves is really frustrating and stupid. Starvation should be the result of bad player decisions rather than unlucky randomness.
- In the Hamlet mode of the game, certain NPCs will occupy resource slots that you need for de-stressing your heroes. It's not very impactful to the game (as in, the NPCs rarely took a slot I really needed), however, it feels like a real slap in the face from the game designer. I paid for those extra slots through sweat, blood, and tears. Having the designer invalidate my choices and hard work is BS.
- Once you've finished upgrading the Hamlet, there is nothing to spend the upgrade resources on... it would be nice to at least be able to trade them in for a bit of cash.
- After delving into the Darkest Dungeon, any surviving heroes will have a torch appear on their roster entry. This mechanic is not explained at all in-game, requiring you to search online and be potentially exposed to spoilers. The game should explain that in Radiant mode it means that (1) the hero will have a huge penalty to stress and virtue if they attempt to re-enter the Darkest Dungeon, (2) you gain a new Hamlet roster slot, and (3) the torched hero gives an XP bonus to their companions, making it faster to train new recruits they accompany.
- This special Darkest Dungeon mechanic also makes the game take unnecessarily longer. It turned the last 10 hours or so of the game into a grind.
- If you want the heroes to turn back along a corridor and return to the room from which they came, the heroes will walk backwards. This is frankly bizarre.

THE UGLY:

- During a dungeon delve, the way the heroes' movement is always left-to-right can be quite confusing at times. It's completely divorced from the map, where you might actually be moving right-to-left.
- When using a console controller during combat, the game will sometimes (seemingly randomly) pre-select your combat option from last round. This inconsistency can cause you to make muscle-memory input errors at crucial moments.

184769055.review:
You and your partner are on good terms? Everything is great at work? You're debt-free and living comfortably? You're sticking to your New Year's resolution and improving yourself? If things are going TOO well, if you're starting to miss the feeling of stress, if you're getting bored of being constantly hopeful, then oh boy - do I have the game for you. 

Darkest Dungeon is a dreary tale told through lofty vocabulary and uncompromising gameplay. Out there in the dungeons, danger lurks at every corner. Sooner or later, you WILL overlook a threat, you WILL become overconfident, and inevitably, things WILL go wrong. The game is upfront with you about this. If you are willing to embrace its oppressive difficulty, you might learn to appreciate that preparation truly matters in Darkest Dungeon. That you can't just throw together a hero roster willy-nilly and hope for the best. That brief moments of respite need to be treasured. That victories are hard-won and thus oh-so-satisfying. 

What truly sets Darkest Dungeon apart is its impeccable cohesiveness. Everything, from the general theme, sounds effects, music, visuals, to the very gameplay mechanics that govern it, comes together into one inseparable whole to form the uniquely grim atmosphere of Darkest Dungeon. 
Oh, and also - the narrator's voice is pure despair-ridden bliss. 

Though it may not be the game for everyone, Darkest Dungeon flawlessly accomplishes its bleak, punishing vision. 
9/10, a masterpiece.

184683856.review:
Amazing game.
I don't really like turned based games very much but Darkest Dungeon is the exception for me, It's also my first Dungeon Crawler game.
Visually this game is a treat to look at the dark atmosphere and artstyle are beautiful.

There are two parts to the game: managing your heros and party and then sending them into a dungeon to fight monsters and eldritch horrors. The combat gameplay is easily the best part about this game. When you make a party of heros that end up doing really well together it feels great. I've never felt more satisfied seeing numbers on a screen. The Narrator also has an awesome voice that really adds to the game.
The only thing I don't really like about Darkest Dungeon is how some heros are locked behind paid DLC. The Flagellent for example is a really good hero but costs money to unlock. I wouldn't say this game is P2W because it's not, you will definetley still struggle a lot even if you have the dlc heros. I just don't like how charcters are locked behind a paywall because that means that team combos are locked behind a paywall. Flagellent and Plague Doctor are a nasty duo with his bleed and her blight but you can only access this duo by paying extra money.

184564181.review:
The aesthetic of this game is incredible - the music, character designs and narration is top notch. This is a work of art first and foremost.

The format is really innovative with the scrolling dungeon exploration, unique turn based combat mechanics and the hamlet. I liked the 'do or die' nature of it - when you lose characters they are gone permanently and there is a sense of genuine risk involved (you can't just quickload and bring them all back into existence.)

I can see why people would be into the 'grinding' and 'maximizing your party' aspect, but that side really wasn't for me. Toward the end it got a bit repetitive and I started to get bored of it all. 

My motivation for playing RPGs is for the story / characters and Darkest Dungeon isn't that kind of game. The setting is really good and immersive, but there wasn't a narrative to keep me hooked. Making the best possible party or spending unforeseen hours grinding into an abyss is too time consuming an ordeal for me.

Well worth trying when it's on sale again, but be aware that it won't be for everyone.

184550155.review:
8.7/10

[hr][/hr]

以组建4人小队下副本形式结合包含中长经营培养的回合制游戏。且都具有相当程度的随机性。

回合制部分：有着经常能看到的基于站位的技能系统（站12位打1234位），更引入了别具一格的压力系统和亮度机制。

中长经营培养部分：所有的副本奖励都是基于其难度的随机奖励（主要是通关饰品不同），除了少数副本为固定地图固定敌人(通关关卡DD本，DLC猩红庭院副本)，其余都是随机地图随机敌人配置。同时角色拥有5个正面天赋槽和5个负面天赋槽，几乎所有天赋的获取都是随机获得的。

容易被忽略但其实是核心的亮度与背包机制：亮度与敌我双方暴击率，战利品获取数量有关，而背包则是需要玩家在不同的战利品甚至补给品与战利品中间取舍。

[hr][/hr]

[h3] 好 [/h3]

[olist]
    [*]能被称之为惊心动魄的回合制
角色永久死亡的机制 + 出手速度、技能命中率和暴击率中的随机性 + 光亮机制对于双方暴击率和命中率的提升，
满血的角色在下一个回合被残血的敌人一刀带走，又或是减员的我方在下一回合刀刀烈火，都是*不小*概率的事件，该概率会随着副本等级的提升以及玩家饰品获取数量的提升从*中低*概率变为*中高*概率，这其中在角色的7个技能中选4个搭配上对应的饰品构成了角色的不同打法，有着相当的搭配空间
    [*]有足够可玩性的配队策略
基于压力和站位两个系统，有着长续航和短爆发两种配队，解压是想办法拖战解压，还是扎营解压，在结束配队时是能预测大概的战损的；反过来说，错误的配队几乎一定会导致*进去4个疯了5个*甚至全军覆没的结果
    [*]基于背包与亮度的取舍机制
越低的亮度，双方暴击率命中率越高，压力怪上的压力越高，战利品越丰厚，越多强力的饰品可以生效，同时越容易一击暴毙；越是装满战利品的背包，越是缺少战斗中的补给品，越是容易在一次不期而遇的战斗中崩盘，且战利品获取一定会溢出；由此衍生出来的高光和低光思路，以及如何最有效的贪战利品的背包管理都是很有乐趣部分
   [*]类似长流程肉鸽的体验
饰品获取是随机的，每周能获取的新角色是随机的，角色获得的天赋是随机的，每个副本中能收获的战利品次数和数量是随机的。每个不同的地区副本有着其独特的产物，针对副本奖励合理规划副本的安排也是策略中的一环。
   [*]充足内容的创意工坊
从几乎必备的战斗加速MOD，和对新手及其有用的互动物提示MOD，到弱势职业的技能重做，新的饰品和新的敌人，以及新的职业都能在创意工坊找到
[/olist]

[h3] 坏 [/h3]

[olist]
    [*]复杂机制带来的上手难度
游玩策略上选择以高光为主还是低光为主，配队策略抉择长续航还是短爆发加扎营解压的同时也要避免主力角色等级过高（会无法进入低级副本），战斗需要兼顾伤害、回血和解压，同时战利品的选择要针对当前建筑升级规划。以及相当多需要记住如何互动的特殊物品（副本中的“宝箱”需要背包里有对应的道具才能有效获取，这里推荐新手打“奇物互动提示MOD”）
    [*]令人费解的难度设计
游戏中副本分为四个难度：学徒、精英、冠军、以及通关副本极暗地牢（DD本），其中非常反直觉的，冠军本难度显著高于DD本。同时几乎全部的BOSS都为兼顾机制与伤害的BOSS，使得初见几乎意味着减员，而DD本数值上虽然简单，但其中相当多机制使得初见必定全军覆没。
这使得该游戏看攻略几乎成为了一种必须要做的事（至少得知道BOSS的机制），除非你能很轻松自在的接受你养了七八个小时的角色一次性暴毙4个甚至，连续崩盘2次死8个。
    [*]随机，还是随机，这是乐趣也是痛苦
大起大落在游戏中几乎是常态，上一秒通关了副本安心关灯开宝箱，下一个拐角等着的是无光状态随机刷新的BOSS，若是状态不佳没有补给，这几乎宣告着一次减员；上个回合安心输出打的敌人就剩一个，下一个回合敌人暴击加流血DOT，你的角色脖子一歪直接去世（所有角色自带66%概率受到攻击不死）。85%的致死抗性脖子一歪，110%的命中连空三刀，敌方5%的暴击刀刀烈火，而我方0-15 1d15的治疗次次奶0。这种概率总会在极限场景发生（通常为敌人残血），我称之为红钩概率学。
    [*]角色死亡带来的严重挫败，重走老路，接老路遇爬，接重走老路
永久死
亡是令人挫败的，随机性的暴击或者闪避带来的死亡是更令人崩溃的（尤其是当你打了二次元皮肤MOD），更严重的是其所付出的代价，减员不仅指的你花费在该角色的金钱丢失，同时可能导致剩下的队友爆压力崩溃，滚雪球的状态团灭，若是运气较好能以任务失败的状态撤退，依旧会对活下来的队友造成高额压力从而增加经营难度。
若是不幸团灭则会丢失全部角色穿戴的饰品，需要通过击杀或击退特殊BOSS才能夺回，若是在有通关时间限制的难度，且处于末期，该团灭导致的关键饰品的丢失可能导致无法通关的坏档。
[/olist]

[hr][/hr]

这是个优秀的回合制游戏，但本质还是回合制，你不喜欢回合制游戏，那会玩起来非常折磨。

需要注意的是游戏有大量可以拉低难度的MOD，无论是超模的角色，还是其中最影响平衡的大背包MOD和多饰品栏位MOD，都不建议长时间开，但他们总能带着你轻松通关。
新手期为了过渡了解系统可以打上，但入门后不建议打大背包这种严重影响游戏机制乐趣的MOD，你打了怪物增强MOD就当我没说。

以及，DLC血腥庭院在初次游玩需要谨慎开启，该DLC会引入一个老玩家喜欢但新手无能为力的强力持续性DEBUFF——血病，且该DLC副本关卡极大（普通的3-4倍大小），对于新手过于折磨，至少对于当时新手期的我来说，我压力爆的比里面的角色快多了。

你说得对，但形势还真是急转直下啊！
这一刹那间揭露了些许死亡的意味。
死亡等待在那略微松懈的瞬间……
眩晕着，踉跄着，几近崩溃……
如此可怕的袭击之下绝不可能令人无所反应……
严重的受伤，与显而易见的惊慌！
耳畔鸣响，视线模糊——终结已至……
对身体与心灵的沉重打击！
失去平衡，失去信心……
——受到这致命的一击……
徘徊在那湮灭陡峭的边缘……
遍体鳞伤，仅存一息……
在死亡的边缘摇摇欲坠，面对着无尽的深渊！
现在，真正的考验来了……是撑住，还是就这样消逝?
当生命衰弱的时候，来自死亡的那可怕、空虚的远景便会显露出来。
人的心智——如知更鸟的蛋般柔弱。
为何会这样，英雄主义呢？
心灵无法被期望于禁得住如此的打击。
甚至就连年长的橡木都将被最猛烈的风刮倒。
疯狂，吾之旧友！
人有时能在疯狂中醍醐灌顶，不过实在太过稀少……
疯狂——是智慧最崇高的形态， 或者只是有人曾这么说过。
心灵的堡垒已经沦陷了！
深渊被人为地制造了出来！
更多的鲜血渗入了土壤，喂养着那里的邪惧之物。
又一条性命白白地惨死在那追求名誉与财富的路上。
这里不是弱者和莽夫，该来的地方。
更多的尘埃，更多的灰烬，更加的失望

184372320.review:
[h1]Darkest Dungeon - Quand la folie te guette à chaque coin de rue[/h1]

[p]Ah, *Darkest Dungeon*. Ce jeu où tu penses pouvoir gérer une équipe de héros, mais tu finis par gérer des crises de panique, de stress et de... disons, de mauvaise humeur. Ce jeu te plonge dans un monde sombre, où chaque décision peut être ta dernière, et où tes héros sont plus susceptibles de sombrer dans la folie que de sauver le village. Bienvenue dans un vrai test de patience et de stratégie ![/p]

[h2]Les aspects positifs :[/h2]

[p]1. Ambiance incroyable : L’atmosphère du jeu est parfaitement glauque. Des musiques angoissantes aux graphismes qui respirent la misère, tu es dans un monde où l’espoir est aussi rare qu’une victoire sans pertes. C'est l’horreur psychologique à son meilleur. Rien de tel que de voir tes héros se transformer en épaves tout en avançant dans un donjon terrifiant.[/p]

[p]2. Gestion du stress : C’est vraiment ce qui fait la différence dans ce jeu. Ton équipe peut devenir folle, souffrir de phobies et de dépressions, et cette gestion du stress devient un gameplay à part entière. C’est presque aussi stressant que gérer ton propre emploi du temps, mais avec des épées et des monstres. Si tu pensais que tu étais bon pour gérer le stress, ce jeu va te prouver le contraire.[/p]

[p]3. Combat tactique : Les combats sont super stratégiques. Chaque mouvement, chaque attaque, chaque soin est essentiel. Les batailles sont comme des puzzles où, si tu fais une erreur, tu risques de perdre un de tes précieux héros (et là, ce n’est pas la colère qui va t’envahir, mais un profond désespoir). Chaque victoire est une bouffée d'air frais, mais elle est toujours suivie par une nouvelle épreuve.[/p]

[h2]Les aspects négatifs :[/h2]

[p]1. Difficulté impitoyable : Si tu cherches un jeu pour détendre ton esprit, *Darkest Dungeon* n’est pas pour toi. La difficulté est extrême, et les pertes sont fréquentes. Si tu es du genre à pleurer après la mort d'un personnage (même fictif), ce jeu va sérieusement mettre tes nerfs à l’épreuve.[/p]

[p]2. Progrès lents : Avancer dans le jeu peut parfois être un peu frustrant. La progression n’est pas rapide et il faut souvent reconstruire ton équipe après une série d’échecs cuisants. Si tu n’aimes pas l’idée de mourir et recommencer encore et encore, tu risques de t’ennuyer. Mais bon, comme dirait le jeu lui-même, « la souffrance forge l’âme ». Parfois, il faut souffrir pour avancer.[/p]

[h2]Le prix :[/h2]

[p]Le prix de *Darkest Dungeon* est assez raisonnable pour un jeu aussi complexe et riche. Si tu veux une expérience de jeu qui te tient en haleine pendant des heures, c’est un excellent investissement. Et avec quelques promotions, tu peux même faire une bonne affaire,(3,67e) mais sache que chaque centime investi te coûtera des heures de stress, de désespoir ou de triomphe.[/p]

[h2]Le platine :[/h2]

[p]Pour obtenir le platine, prépare-toi à investir un bon paquet d’heures. Entre 100 et 170 heures selon ta capacité à survivre aux horreurs du donjon, tu vas devoir faire face à la folie, aux pertes et à des morts répétées. Mais si tu cherches vraiment à atteindre la perfection, attends-toi à faire face à des défis qui te feront rêver de rédemption. Certaines réussites sont un véritable défi, et tu te sentiras sur le point de craquer à chaque fois que tu perds un héros précieux. Tu te souviendras de ces moments…[/p]

[h2]Conclusion :[/h2]

[p]Si tu veux un jeu qui teste non seulement tes compétences stratégiques mais aussi ta capacité à gérer l’agonie mentale de tes héros (et la tienne), alors *Darkest Dungeon* est pour toi. Ce n’est pas un jeu facile, et il te faudra beaucoup de patience pour avancer, mais chaque victoire est d’autant plus gratifiante. Prépare-toi à sacrifier tes héros, ton temps et, peut-être, ta santé mentale pour en venir à bout. Mais une fois que tu maîtrises le stress, tu te sentiras comme un véritable conquérant des ténèbres. Ou comme un fou, ce qui revient au même.[/p]

I've not played too much at the time of this review, however absolutely adore the concept of this game.

It is quite literally an RPG where the BS that your party members encounter actually affect them, mental health is actually a considered element and I love that. The game is all about adapting to a completely miserable situation for everyone, and it makes it so your personal morals are an aspect. I love that!! It's so damn cool. This game is so relentless and as a big RPG fan + rougelike enjoyer it's right up my alley. 

Additionally I love the gothic horror influence here, I'm a big Edgar Allen Poe fan and all that, its visual style is a treat and reminiscent of things like Don't Starve. All around great and I cannot wait to play more.

184261900.review:
Darkest Dungeon, developed by Red Hook Studios, is a dark, turn-based strategy game that has captivated gamers since its release in 2016. Set in a gothic, horror-themed world, the game puts players in control of a group of adventurers tasked with exploring dungeons filled with grotesque monsters, ancient evil, and nightmarish challenges. What sets Darkest Dungeon apart from other dungeon crawlers is its emphasis on psychological stress and the toll it takes on the characters, making it a unique and challenging experience. However, this dark, unforgiving gameplay might not be for everyone.

Gameplay and Mechanics

At its core, Darkest Dungeon is a roguelike dungeon crawler. Players assemble a team of adventurers, each with unique classes and abilities, and send them into dungeons to explore, fight monsters, and gather loot. The twist, however, lies in the psychological stress system. Adventurers accumulate stress as they face terrifying enemies, perilous situations, and even each other. This stress can lead to various afflictions, such as fear, paranoia, or even full-on madness. This unique system means that managing the mental well-being of your characters is just as important as physical health.

In terms of gameplay, Darkest Dungeon is ruthless. Combat is turn-based and tactical, requiring players to carefully manage positioning, abilities, and resources. The game's difficulty is a key aspect of its design—failure is inevitable, and your characters will die, sometimes in horrific and permanent ways. This is a core part of the experience; each death feels meaningful, contributing to the sense of loss and desperation that permeates the game. The balance of risk and reward is ever-present, as players must decide whether to push deeper into dungeons for more loot or retreat before their team succumbs to madness or death.

Outside of combat, Darkest Dungeon requires players to manage their base, the Hamlet. Here, players can treat their heroes' afflictions, upgrade buildings, and recruit new adventurers. The base management adds a layer of strategy, as players must prioritize which characters to heal, which to send on missions, and when to invest in upgrading their facilities.

Stress and Mental Health

One of the standout features of Darkest Dungeon is its innovative psychological system. As mentioned, characters accumulate stress from various sources—losing battles, witnessing death, or even the horrors of the dungeon itself. This stress can lead to negative traits or even mental breakdowns, which can severely hinder a character’s abilities. Some characters may become paranoid, making them less effective in battle or even disobeying orders, while others may develop debilitating phobias or compulsions. Managing this system is vital, as a high-stress character can quickly spiral into madness and leave your team in peril.

There is also the option to send heroes to stress-relief activities like gambling, drinking, or even meditating. However, these activities come at a cost, and not all of them are equally effective. It adds a layer of complexity to the strategy, where managing the mental health of your adventurers is just as critical as keeping their physical health in check.

Combat and Difficulty

The combat in Darkest Dungeon is slow, deliberate, and highly tactical. Characters are placed in specific positions in the formation, each with different abilities that work best in particular spots. For example, some characters are stronger in the front lines, while others are better suited for the back. Understanding the strengths and weaknesses of each class is essential for victory.

Enemies in the dungeons are often formidable, with many having unique abilities that require different tactics to counter. The game features a variety of foes, from grotesque monsters to eldritch horrors that inflict psychological damage on your team. Boss fights are particularly challenging, requiring careful planning and precise execution. The difficulty of Darkest Dungeon is notorious for being punishing, and while the challenge may deter some players, it is one of the aspects that make the game so rewarding. Every victory feels earned, and the sense of dread and uncertainty keeps the experience fresh.

Graphics and Sound Design

Visually, Darkest Dungeon uses a distinctive hand-drawn art style that perfectly complements its dark tone. The gothic, grimy aesthetic reflects the world’s bleakness, and the character designs are strikingly detailed, with each class having unique visual traits. The dungeon environments are diverse, ranging from torch-lit catacombs to eerie, dark forests, all adding to the atmosphere of dread.

The game’s soundtrack and sound design also enhance the experience. The music is ominous and brooding, creating a sense of impending doom, while the sound effects—such as the growl of monsters or the sound of footsteps in the dark—heighten the tension. One of the standout elements of the sound design is the narrator, whose voice lines, filled with gravitas and doom, constantly remind the player of the dangers their characters face. The narrator’s commentary adds to the atmosphere, emphasizing the emotional weight of the story.

Progression and Replayability

Darkest Dungeon offers a robust progression system, with over 15 hero classes, each with unique abilities and strengths. As players progress through the game, they unlock new adventurers, items, and challenges, allowing for different strategies and playstyles. The game also has a variety of different dungeons and regions to explore, each with their own set of challenges and enemies.

The roguelike elements add replayability to the game. Since characters can die permanently and each run is different, no two playthroughs are the same. Players must learn from their failures and adapt their strategies accordingly. However, this can also be frustrating, as repeated failures are a common occurrence. While the game’s difficulty is part of its charm, it can also be a source of frustration, particularly when players lose progress due to a team’s poor mental health or a disastrous dungeon run.

Weaknesses

1. High Difficulty: The game is extremely difficult, and failure is inevitable. While this is part of the experience, it can be frustrating for some players.
2. Stress Management: The psychological stress system, while innovative, can feel punishing at times, making it challenging to maintain a stable team.
3. Randomness: The roguelike nature of the game means that much of the experience is subject to random chance, which can lead to setbacks that feel out of the player’s control.

Strengths

1. Innovative Stress System: The psychological elements add a unique layer of strategy and tension.
2. Challenging Combat: Tactical turn-based combat that requires planning and precision.
3. Distinct Visual Style: A beautiful hand-drawn art style that complements the dark tone.
4. Engaging Sound Design: Atmospheric music and a haunting narrator add to the experience.
5. Replayability: The game’s roguelike elements and random events offer high replay value.

Conclusion

Darkest Dungeon is a masterclass in creating a challenging, atmospheric experience. Its dark themes, psychological stress mechanics, and punishing difficulty combine to create a game that is as rewarding as it is brutal. The game offers an incredible amount of depth and strategy, but its relentless difficulty and focus on managing stress may turn off some players. However, for those who enjoy a dark and strategic challenge, Darkest Dungeon is a must-play that rewards patience, planning, and resilience. It’s a game that doesn’t just test your tactical skills but your ability to cope with the emotional weight of constant failure and loss.

184222327.review:
Darkest Dungeon — это игра, которая завоевала популярность благодаря своему уникальному сочетанию элементов ролевого и стратегического жанров, а также своей трудности и глубокой атмосфере.

[h1]Графика и атмосфера[/h1]
С первых минут игры вас поражает её визуальный стиль. Темный, готический дизайн с акварельными элементами создает мрачную, напряженную атмосферу. Музыкальное сопровождение и звуковые эффекты усиливают чувство страха и тревоги, что идеально подходит для исследовательского ужаса, с которым игроки сталкиваются в подземельях.

[h1]Геймплей[/h1]
Игровой процесс в Darkest Dungeon основан на управлении группой героев, которых вы отправляете в различные подземелья для выполнения квестов. Игроки должны тщательно подбирать состав группы, учитывая классы героев и их взаимодействия. Каждое решение имеет последствия, а риск потерять персонажей высок — порой даже малейшая ошибка может привести к фатальным последствиям.

[h1]Стресс и психология[/h1]
Одной из самых уникальных механик в игре является система стресса. Герои получают психологические травмы, которые могут повлиять на их поведение в бою и вне его. Это добавляет дополнительный уровень стратегии, поскольку вам нужно не только следить за здоровьем ваших персонажей, но и за их психическим состоянием. Управление стрессом становится важной частью успеха.

[h1]Сложность[/h1]
Darkest Dungeon известна своей сложностью. Игроки могут столкнуться с серьёзными трудностями, и успешное прохождение может потребовать нескольких попыток. Это подчеркивает значение планирования, стратегии и подготовки. Каждый босс и каждая локация имеют свои особенности, что требует от игроков гибкости в подходе к бою и исследованию.

[h1]Заключение[/h1]
В целом, Darkest Dungeon предлагает глубокий, проработанный и сложный опыт, который может привлечь как любителей ролевых игр, так и тех, кто ищет что-то более стратегическое и эмоционально насыщенное. Если вам нравятся игры с сильной атмосферой, высоким уровнем сложности и уникальными механиками, Darkest Dungeon — отличный выбор.

184162589.review:
Gameplay
At its core, Darkest Dungeon is all about stress management. Seriously, it’s less about killing monsters and more about keeping your party from completely losing their minds. Each adventurer has quirks and stress levels that you’ll need to manage carefully, or they’ll start freaking out mid-dungeon. And trust me, when your healer refuses to heal because they’ve hit their breaking point, you’re in for a bad time.

The turn-based combat is strategic and unforgiving. You’ll need to think carefully about positioning, abilities, and party composition. If you don’t, expect to see your heroes get wrecked. And when they die, they’re gone for good—permadeath is the name of the game here.

Story
The story is simple but effective. You’re trying to reclaim your family’s estate, which has been overrun by all sorts of horrors. The narration by Wayne June is absolutely top-tier and adds a ton of atmosphere to the game. Honestly, his voice alone is worth the price of admission.

But really, the story takes a backseat to the emergent narratives that come from your adventures. Each run has its own drama, with heroes rising to the occasion or completely falling apart. It’s these moments that make the game memorable.

Graphics and Art Style
The 2D art style is fantastic. It’s dark, gritty, and perfectly matches the game’s bleak tone. The monster designs are super creepy, and the environments are dripping with atmosphere. It’s not the most graphically advanced game, but it doesn’t need to be—the style carries it.

Audio
The soundtrack is moody and fits the game’s tone perfectly. And again, Wayne June’s narration? Absolute perfection. His grim delivery makes even the simplest lines feel epic. The sound effects, from the clinking of armor to the screeches of enemies, all add to the immersion.

Pros and Cons
Pros:

Deep, strategic gameplay that’s super rewarding.

Stress and quirk systems add a unique twist.

Gorgeous art style and incredible narration.

Tons of replayability.

Cons:

Brutally tough and not for the faint of heart.

Can feel grindy at times.

RNG can be downright cruel.

Seems to be Impossible to know what their traits are until their stress reaches that point where it shows u in the middle of a battle- and if the devs see this, pls make it so characters with that trait don't completely tell the healer to F off, because if the healer could've done their job, i probably could've saved a character or two :(

 3 of those were deaths were in the same mission, and i'm writing this review right after having to run from said mission with my last hero of those 4 (as you can only bring 4 per mission , at least in the beginning... maybe you unlock more slots as the game progresses idk). 

In my essentially 13 years of playing video games, i've never had this much of a challenge in a game and to be fair, i don't play anything like this usually but i bought it for like 10.09 Euro , which included all DLCs. A massive bargain but i'd imagine others have acquired this for cheaper, though i'd say that even at full price this is wortth buying if you're into this sort of genre.

BUT, not only is this challenging but also very fun- if one is able avoid growing attached to any of their heroes, or you're in for a very rough time, ngl. 

I say this because you should expect to lost 1 hero on average per mission, at a minimum... from the very get go, except in the tutorial itself, if you catch onto the basics immediately (quite simple basics ngl but i've played a game with similar basics before so best to keep that in mind, that not everyone will get the basics from the very first battle, most likely.

I should probably play more before making this review, but it felt worth posting one because not even 3 hours in and the difficulty on this is nearly perfect, though i kinda wish the "traits that activate after stress reaches a certain threshold" (idk what the term would be) wasn't seemingly completely hidden from view, like it literally doesn't exist on the UI... but i'm probably either blind or i didn't read the tutorial popups well enough, who knows :(

 I've never played a game where easy mode is hard mode , but i've never played Dark Souls or Elden Ring either... so maybe i'm just too much of a noob to this specific genre (the "getting your ass kicked until you win" genre) 

Also, I kinda wish there was a "turn order" in battles but i'm probably too new to this game to have figured out where the button for that is... unless there isn't one and that's intentional design to make it so you can't come up with strategies because you don't know the turn order. 

Tbf this is a dark souls sort of game so i wouldn't be surprised if 'quality of life' things like turn orders and actually being shown certain things about your heroes (like the masochistic trait) are deliberately not features because it makes you have to actually use your brain even more and you have as a result of not having information at your disposal, go through learning about each hero's strengths and weaknesses through gameplay

Rating: ★★★☆☆

[h2]Overview[/h2]
This game is not for everyone and Steam does not allow a neutral review.

The Darkest Dungeon doesn’t want you to play it—it wants to humiliate you, waste your time, and laugh at your pain. A gothic roguelike strategy game combines grueling difficulty with oppressive systems that will have you questioning why you’re still playing. Sure, it looks great, and the narrator is iconic, but once you get past the novelty, the cracks start to show. If you like Cthulhu theme and turn based combat, you can give the main game a go with [u]the discounted price.[/u]
[h2]Pros[/h2]
[list]
[*][b]Atmosphere:[/b] There’s no denying it: The Darkest Dungeon looks and sounds incredible. Its hand-drawn art style oozes dread and decay, while the narrator’s grim commentary perfectly underscores the oppressive tone. Few games make you feel this immersed in despair.
[*][b]Unique Stress System:[/b] The stress mechanic is brilliant in theory. Watching your party members spiral into hopelessness or snap under pressure adds tension and immersion. But while it’s interesting, it often feels like a mechanic designed to infuriate rather than entertain.
[*][b]Replayability:[/b] If you enjoy punishment, The Darkest Dungeon offers endless ways to suffer. With dozens of characters to choose from and randomized dungeons, every run feels unique at the start. That said, you’ll need a high tolerance for repetition and frustration to make the most of it.
[/list]
[h2]Cons[/h2]
[list]
[*][b]Difficulty or Sadism?[/b] There’s a fine line between challenging and downright unfair, and The Darkest Dungeon doesn’t care where that line is. The early game is a slow grind, and the late game is an RNG nightmare. The game punishes even the most well-executed strategies with unpredictable outcomes, making success feel more like blind luck than skill.
[*][b]Grinding for the Sake of Grinding:[/b] Prepare to spend hours micromanaging your party’s stress levels, diseases, and quirks, only to see them fall apart the moment you dive into another dungeon. This endless loop of repairing and breaking down isn’t rewarding—it’s exhausting.
[*][b]RNG Overload:[/b] Strategy? Ha. In The Darkest Dungeon, RNG trumps all. Even the best plans can crumble when your attacks miss three times in a row, and the enemy crits you into oblivion. When every turn feels like a dice roll, the challenge stops being fun and starts feeling unfair.
[*][b]DLCs Make It Worse:[/b] If you thought the base game was cruel, wait until you meet the DLCs. The Crimson Court adds a vampiric blood mechanic that’s just more micromanagement on top of the grind. The Color of Madness throws endless waves of enemies at you, perfect for those who like their misery in bulk. And The Shieldbreaker? Cool hero, but her added mechanics (like ambush nightmares) feel like another kick to the gut in an already punishing game.
[*][b]Repetition, Repetition, Repetition:[/b] While the game boasts random dungeons, the actual gameplay loop becomes predictable fast: similar layouts, recycled stress mechanics, same frustrating RNG. The novelty wears off quickly, leaving you with a grind-heavy experience.
[/list]
[h2]Conclusion[/h2] The Darkest Dungeon is like a bad relationship: it starts off exciting and intense, but soon you’re just frustrated, exhausted, and wondering why you’re still putting up with it. The atmosphere and narration are incredible, but the relentless grind, unfair RNG, and repetitive gameplay drag it down. The DLCs don’t help—they just pile more misery onto an already overwhelming experience. Yet still it is a purchase with discount.

183949112.review:
Darkest Dungeon, what is there to say. Its an Rpg with Roguelike elements and permadeath for your characters. This game has taught me the value of human life, basically nothing. Throw hundreds all "heroes" into the maelstrom of horrific dungeons plunging them into the deepest depths of insanity, then throw them to the curbside because treating their mental illnesses (and regular illnesses) are too expensive. Contrary to your beloved heroes, the trinkets you acquire are of great importance if you want to actually conquer the higher level dungeons. Losing a 4-stack of maxed heroes and all your legendary trinkets feels worse than losing a loved one. With failure comes learning, and failure can sometimes be inevitable, sometimes you get crit to deaths door and die to a bleed, sometimes you get 3 blocked tunnels in a row, sometimes you forgot to check if the thing from the stars is in the dungeon and you're running a blight team, learning from these kinds of circumstances is one of the biggest thrills this game has to offer. Slowly recognizing everything these god-forsaken tombs have to throw at you, and dismantling every challenge you face is one of the most satisfying feelings in gaming. Sometimes this game feels like a punishment, sometimes a blessing from god, sometimes I wish I was playing the second one, but in the end I think it was worth it.

7/10 nerf cytokinesis

183911628.review: Years after I played this game, surprised I never wrote a review, probably because I never finished. Darkest Dungeon is a fantastic game visually, narratively, musically. The game has one of the single best narrators of all time, infinitely quotable, never tiresome, deeply memorable. The gameplay is difficult, but fun. Death lurks around every corner, but once you get into the rhythm of it, and with a bit of luck, you'll squeak by. It's one of the very few times I actually enjoyed a "difficult" game. The only problem, is the late game grind. Without spoilers, the final dungeon is in multiple parts, and each individual party member can only enter one of these parts one time. That means whatever team you're using can only enter the first part, not the other three. In practice this means to beat the game you need four full parties of sufficient level, and that's assuming you survive all four times without dying. I couldn't do that, couldn't be bothered to grind out the extra teams. Loved the game though, and the Crimson Court DLC was fun. Loved their take on "vampires".

为难而难的游戏。督战队模拟器。

这游戏你输了负反馈，放弃战役给负反馈，赢了也给负反馈，游戏BGM跟tm给开发者自己出殡一样情绪全程都是往下走。
正反馈几乎为零，除了下地牢就是下地牢，中间哪怕减员招募不到也必须下地牢，真就天线宝宝，你就跟个督战队一样让他们去送死，放弃战役？你的天线宝宝们又不乐意了你放弃他们啥也没干就能凭空多出几个负面特质。哪怕你的天线宝宝们赢了，结算的时候还是能给你负面特质。惊不惊喜？意不意外？是的特质全靠摸奖美名其为肉鸽。

哪怕你用上所有的资源做好万无一失的准备，也架不住天线宝宝们发疯、不听命令、跳过自己回合、自杀、嘴臭抱怨、给自己上仇恨debuff等等各种逆天操作。
举例：残局对面就剩一个血皮杂兵，我方全员半血存活，然后硬是各种失误自杀了两个，送死一个，剩一个精英顶着自己的面板高硬是跳了自己N个回合直到最后自己也濒死才补刀成功。
确实挺有节目效果的，但是剧本感很明显。

可能这游戏正确玩法是MOD？
